newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Quake jolts Pakistan's Quetta valley.
newsitem.headline: Quake jolts Pakistan's Quetta valley.

text.p: A moderate earthquake jolted the Quetta valley in southwestern Pakistan on Tuesday afternoon, but there was no immediate report of any casualties or damage, government officials said.

The meteorological office in Quetta, capital of Baluchistan province bordering Iran and Afghanistan, said the quake hit the area at 4:19 p.m. (1119 gmt) and measured five on Richter scale, powerful enough to cause heavy damage in a populated area.
It was centred some 160 km (100 miles) north of Quetta in the Suleman mountain range.
A violent earthquake in the area in February killed about 80 people.
